alert.note: Alert for Union (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 09 at 10:58PM EDT until September 10 at 1:15AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM EDT SUNDAY FOR NORTHEASTERN UNION NC COUNTY... At 1058 PM EDT, the public reported flash flooding along Chinkapin Creek near Uniondale. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Public reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Monroe, Unionville, Wingate, Marshville and Fairview In Union County. Flooding will continue along Chinkapin Creek, Mill Creek, Richardson Creek, and other tributaries to the Rocky River in the warned area. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
